Work Experience

Throughout my university career I have seeked out many opportunities to further my education in the form of work experience. These opportunities have been through both my co-operative education program, as well as opportunities that I pursued on my own. This page contains descriptions of all the positions that I have held."




Soft Matter Research Student (Dr. Anand Yethiraj)

Dr. Anand Yethiraj and his group, including myself during my time there, are currently conducting experiments on colloids in the presence of electric fields. the goal is to discover more about the dynamics of these particles. Reponsibilities: - Manually producing test chambers - Adjusting the refractive index of the solution to collect more meaningful results. - Conducting experiments involving colloids - Analyzing results of experiments - Conducting image processing on the results of the experiments




System Planning Co-op Student (Newfoundland Power Inc.)

Newfoundland Power is the primary distribution utility in Newfoundland, however they are also involved with generation using gas, diesel and water turbines. The System Planning Department at Newfoundland Power Inc. is responsible for conducting studies on the company's electrical system and assessing the validity of the assets incorporated within. This information is used to help plan for additions to and reconfiguration of the system in the future to ensure the company provides proper service to the customers.

Optics and Photonics Researcher (Dr. Qiying Chen)

Researchers at the Optics and Photonics Research Laboratory study optical science and technology on the time scale of femtoseconds and the length scale of nanometers. The primary techniques include wavelength-tunable femtosecond lasers and near-field scanning optical microscopes.

Curtiss-Wright (Software Co-op)

At Curtiss-Wright as a Software Engineering Co-op, I gained significant experience with many different operating systems including Linux, Windows, and the RTOS VxWorks. In this position, focus was mainly on the development, testing and verification of embedded software. I was involved with the development of firmware, PBIT, PABS and other pieces of software essential to the BSPs This position gave me a great understanding of computer architecture and single board computers. By collaborating closely with hardware engineers, this work term allowed me to see both sides of the high tech world and gave me a deep understanding of how hardware and software work together. During this work term I also spent a large amount of time automating tests. Through this I learned to think outside of the box and develop creative solutions to problems.
